intro: Senecio odontopterus, commonly known as the toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
